what: World Population Data from the UN
title: World Population Data from the UN
text: populaR provides convenient interface UN’s World Population Prospects API. Several pre-baked datasets included, well convenient wrapper advanced API users

title: World Population Data from the UN
text: can install development version populaR GitHub :

title: World Population Data from the UN
text: First get numeric ID location. can get_id function type = "locations". know exact wording, set search = FALSE speed query. , need numeric ID indicator. can search way Common indicators include: default, package clean API columns, return quite lot information.
code: library(populaR) get_id("Australia", type = "locations", .progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 5 × 6 #>      id name                                      iso3  iso2  longitude latitude #>   <int> <chr>                                     <chr> <chr>     <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1    36 Australia                                 AUS   AU         134.    -25.3 #> 2   927 Australia/New Zealand                     ANZ   ZL          NA      NA   #> 3  1834 Australia/New Zealand                     ANZ   ZL          NA      NA   #> 4  1835 Oceania (excluding Australia and New Zea… OCA   OZ          NA      NA   #> 5  5502 Europe, Northern America, Australia, and… SDG   SD          NA      NA get_id("Population by 5-year age groups and sex", type = "Indicators", .progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>      id name                                    shortName       description      #>   <int> <chr>                                   <chr>           <chr>            #> 1    46 Population by 5-year age groups and sex PopByAge5AndSex Annual populati…

what: Filter WPP age data by country — filter_country
title: Filter WPP age data by country — filter_country
text: Filters WPP age data country

title: Filter WPP age data by country — filter_country
Filter WPP age data by country — filter_country
text: .data tibble containing WPP age data country Name country location_column Name location column, unquoted. Default location.

title: Filter WPP age data by country — filter_country
text: tibble containing WPP age data specified country

what: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
title: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
text: Gets age data either 1- 5- year age brackets, potentially segregated sex

title: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
code: get_age_data(   location_id,   age_bracket,   by_sex,   start_year = 1950,   end_year = 2100,   .progress = TRUE )

title: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
text: location_id tibble containing location id interest. Typically output get_id. age_bracket integer. Either 1 5, indicating size brackets by_sex boolean TRUE segregate results sex start_year integer Start year data. Default 1950 (early available) end_year integer End year data. Default 2100 (late available) .progress boolean Whether show progress bar. Default TRUE.

title: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
text: tibble containing location_id, age information, sex, year, slightly cleaner format raw API call.

title: Age data from the WPP API — get_age_data
code: aus_id <- get_id("Australia", type = "locations", search = FALSE, .progress = FALSE) get_age_data(aus_id$id, age_bracket = 5, start_year = 2023, end_year = 2023, by_sex = TRUE) #> Error in check_wpp_api_key(): No API key detected. Set using `set_wpp_key_key()` or inside `.Renviron`

what: Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels
title: Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels
text: Gets information indicators (.e. dataset) locations querying WPP API

title: Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels
Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels
text: target String, one "Indicators" "locations" .progress Boolean, whether show progress bars query progress. Default TRUE

title: Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels
text: tibble containing wide range information requested endpoint

title: Get parameter inputs for population data API — get_base_levels

ℹ 54 more rows #> # ℹ 25 more variables: dimCategory <lgl>, defaultAgeId <int>, #> #   defaultSexId <int>, defaultVariantId <int>, defaultCategoryId <int>, #> #   variableType <chr>, valueType <chr>, unitScaling <dbl>, precision <int>, #> # title: IDs of indicators — get_id

IDs of indicators — get_id
text: name Name variable search type One "locations" "Indicators", dataset search search Whether perform simple search/matching. Defaults TRUE .progress Boolean, whether show progress bars query progress. Default TRUE

title: IDs of indicators — get_id
text: tibble containing matching records. Column id numeric id needed downstream

what: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
text: Get data specific indicator, specific location WPP API need get ID indicators locations get_id pass .

title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
code: get_indicator_data(   indicator_id,   location_id,   start_year = 1950,   end_year = 2100,   .progress = TRUE )

title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
text: indicator_id Numeric ID indicator. Common choices include: 46: Age sex 5 year age groups 47: Age sex 1 year age groups location_id Numeric ID location (country) start_year Numeric. Year start estimates. Minimum 1950, maximum 2100. Default 1950. end_year Numeric. Year end estimates. Minimum 1951, maximum 2100. Default 2100. .progress Boolean. Whether show progress bars query. Default TRUE.

title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
text: tibble following columns: locationId: Numeric ID location location: Description location iso3: 3-character country code location iso2: 2-character country code location locationTypeId: indicatorId: Numeric ID indicator indicator: Description indicator indicatorDisplayName: Publishable display name indicator

title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
text: Note: function looks WPP API key environment variable WPP_API_KEY. can set using set_wpp_api_key .Renviron file.

title: Get WPP data on an indicator from a specific location — get_indicator_data
code: aus_id <- get_id("Australia", type = "locations", search = FALSE, .progress = FALSE) age_id <- get_id("Population by 5-year age groups and sex", type = "Indicators", search = FALSE, .progress = FALSE) get_indicator_data(indicator_id = age_id$id, location_id = aus_id$id, start_year = 2020, end_year = 2024) #> Error in check_wpp_api_key(): No API key detected. Set using `set_wpp_key_key()` or inside `.Renviron`

what: Five year age data, by country, and year — wpp_age_fiveyr
title: Five year age data, by country, and year — wpp_age_fiveyr
text: locationId Numeric location country location Country year Year data, case 2023 ageStart Lower bound age ageEnd Upper bound age population Number individuals
